section.name: Quick Start
section.p: The quickest way to get started is to obtain one of the pre-built packages. Even when adding additional functionalities to your project, you normally don't need to rebuild Hippo Site Toolkit 2.

The getting started packages contain all the core packaged components, but have been pre-configured with a number of modules and settings, to give you a quick overview of the HST2 without having the laborious tasks to first enter content, create users, etcetera.

subsection.name: Download
subsection.p: Two WAR packages are available for download. You can deploy them in either Tomcat or Jetty or any other servlet container that you prefer. Notice: Hippo HST2 has not been released. The following downloads are snapshots of the current build.

li.a: Hippo ECM getting started package WAR
Hippo HST2 getting started package WAR

subsection.name: Deploy, run and access
subsection.p: Below you find how to deploy the application in Tomcat. Once the application has been deployed and started, you can access the Hippo CMS under the URL:

The port number may change if you configured you application or servlet container to run with a different port. When deploy the application on a machine other than your local machine you need to change "localhost" to the correct machine name.

ol.li: Download Tomcat 6.0 from the Apache Tomcat website
Copy the ECM Getting started WAR from the link above to apache-tomcat-6.0.16\webapps\cms.war
Copy the HST2 Getting started WAR from the link above to apache-tomcat-6.0.16\webapps\site.war
Start Tomcat with one of the startup scripts in apache-tomcat-6.0.16\bin
Open your browser and surf to http://localhost:8080/cms/ for the CMS
Open your browser and surf to http://localhost:8080/site/preview/index for the site
